name: 李信明
objective: 教導學生閱讀囊括全球議題的文章，並藉由文章的內容作技巧的訓練，字彙的建構，語言的解析，及思維的啟發。課中延展活動將閱讀內容與聽力、會話、寫作做進一步的連結，並引導學生將所學做有效的應用。
schedule:
Week One: Unit 6: Does Advertising Help or Harm us? 
1.　　Explication of related vocabulary (131)
2.　　Reading I: p113-118
3.　　Questions and Answers from the text 
Week Two: 
1.　　Reading Part II: p119-127
2.　　Grammar and Rhetoric (127: Compound sentence)
3.　　Group assignment(s): Research information connected to this topic in verbal form 
Week Three:
1.　　Group Presentations (Shared paper)
2.　　Questions and Answers
3.　　Summation(s) 
Week Four: 
　　　　   Unit Seven: Why Do People Take Risks?
1.　　Related Vocabulary and Thesis of statement (135-6)
2.　　Reading I: P127-8
3.　　Test Students’ comprehension (Can students detect the main idea of this article and point out the supporting ideas here?) 
Week Five:
　　　　  Unit Seven: To be continued
1.　　Reading II: P140-144
2.　　Grammar Analysis (Shifts between past and present) 
3.　　Group Assignment: Research related topics and share 
Week Six: 
1.　　Group presentations 
2.　　Interactions and responses 
3.　　Summations 
Week Seven:
　　　　Unit Eight: How Can We Make Cities Better Places to Live 
1.　　Questions discussed in advance
2.　　Possible vocabulary that flashes through students’ mind (collective brainstorming)
3.　　Reading I: p157-160 (analysis of texts and thesis statement/supporting ideas)
Week Eight: 
1.　　Reading II: 164-166
2.　　Grammar and Rhetoric (Particles as Adjectives) 
3.　　Group Research
Week Nine: 
1.　　Group presentations
2.　　Questions and answers 
3.　　Summations 
Week Ten: 
1.　　Outside Readings (adapted from monthly magazine, Ivory)
2.　　Analysis—What is the thesis statement here? How many ideas does the writer bring up to support? 
Week Eleven: 
　　 Unit Nine: How Can A Small Amount of Money Make a big Difference?
1.　　Motivation of this article
2.　　Thesis statement and supporting ideas 
3.　　Reading I: 181-184
4.　　Related Vocabulary and Idioms/Phrases 
Week Twelve 
1.　　Reading II: p186-190; 194-5
2.　　What are the Main Ideas?
Week Thirteen
1.　　Students’ Research: Share 
2.　　Collective Discussions 
3.　　Summations 
Week Fourteen 
　　Unit Ten: Do People Communicate Better Now Than in the Past?
1.　　Reading I: 203-7
2.　　What is the thesis statement? What are the supporting ideas?
3.　　What are the related words that pop up in your mind? 
Week Sixteen 
1.　　Reading II: 211-214
2.　　Main Ideas
3.　　Grammar and Rhetoric (Sentence Fragments)
